intro: Trasus hirtus var. compositus, commonly known as the hairy tragus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators. Trasus hirtus var. compositus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and visual appeal.
